thread.title: Bonds firmer as they follow rand | Markets
thread.title_full: Bonds firmer as they follow rand | Markets | BDlive

author: Colleen Goko
title: Bonds firmer as they follow rand | Markets
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK DOMESTIC bond yields compressed on Wednesday morning, taking their cue from the firmer rand.
At 8.40am the benchmark R186 bond was bid at 8.570% and offered at 8.550% from a previous close of 8.590%.
The middle-dated R207 was bid at 8.050% and offered at 8.040% from a Tuesday close of 8.055%.
The rand was trading at R13.8974 to the dollar from its previous close of R13.9761.
Rand Merchant Bank analysts said the absence of major macroeconomic data from China and the recovery in US equity markets had allowed for some stabilisation in risk assets.
"It is quarter-end today, which could be supportive of markets, but don’t be fooled – underlying jitters persist. The global data calendar is light, so the local trade data is the only focus ... today," the analysts said.
A small surplus is expected to have been recorded on the trade balance for August, indicating that SA exported more than it imported. The South African Revenue Service will publish the data later in the afternoon.
A surplus on the trade balance could be an indication of slightly better demand in SA’s trading partner countries such as the US, and less demand for imports due to the effects of a weak rand. A small trade deficit of R397.4m was recorded in July.
